byline.contributor: Eric Dash, Ben Protess, Stephen Castle and Liz Alderman contributed reporting.

abstract: Dow Jones industrial average loses 2.13 percent to close at 11,397; Standard & Poor's 500-stock index drops 23.72 points, or 1.9 percent, to 1,200.86; Nasdaq composite index loses 1.98 percent, to 2,614.92.
snippet: Despite strong gains last week, stocks on Wall Street were back in the red for the year on Monday, following European markets lower as the outlook for a broad solution to the European debt crisis appeared to wane.
lead_paragraph: Despite strong gains last week, stocks on Wall Street were back in the red for the year on Monday, following European markets lower as the outlook for a broad solution to the European debt crisis appeared to wane.

headline.print_headline: Shares Retreat on Concerns About Europe
